thread.title: Hexagon first quarter operating profit just misses forecasts

title: Hexagon first quarter operating profit just misses forecasts
text:
May 4, 2018 / 11:16 AM / in 13 minutes Hexagon first quarter operating profit just misses forecasts Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
STOCKHOLM (Reuters) - Swedish industrial technology firm Hexagon ( HEXAb.ST ) reported first-quarter core earnings below analyst forecasts citing currency headwinds on Friday, and said the oil and gas market had remained challenging.
Adjusted quarterly operating earnings at Stockholm-listed Hexagon rose 12 percent to 198.3 million euros (175 million pounds) from 176.4 million in the year-ago quarter, missing a 200 million forecast in a poll of analysts.
Organic sales growth was 7 percent in the quarter, a decrease from the record 10 percent growth seen in the fourth quarter, and lower than the mean forecast for an 8 percent rise. Reporting by Johannes Hellstrom and Esha Vaish, editing by Helena Soderpalm
